definition: just and honorable
first month of the lunar year
straight/upright/proper/main/principal/to correct/to rectify/exactly/just (at that time)/right (in that place)/(math.) positive
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
light/ray/CL:道[dao4]/bright/only/merely/to use up
Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods

sentences.english: I bought the car in good faith . I didn't know it was stolen.
sentences.chinese: 这辆汽车我是正大光明买下来的，我不知道那是贼赃。

sentences.english: Only when your mind is proper, great, and bright can you shine right through all the darkness!
sentences.chinese: 所以心要正大光明，方能照破一切黑暗。

sentences.english: His part in the affair was quite open and aboveboard.
sentences.chinese: 他参与这件事完全是正大光明的。

sentences.english: The deal was completely open and above board.
sentences.chinese: 这笔交易完全是正大光明的。

sentences.english: Everybody should be fair and square.
sentences.chinese: 每个人都应该公正无私，正大光明。

sentences.english: Walk the walk, and do it visibly, so others can see what you’re doing.
sentences.chinese: 走自己的路，正大光明，所以别人才能够看到你做的。

definition: (of a person) honorable/not devious/(of a behavior) fair and aboveboard/without tricks/openly/(of a situation) out in the open
overt/to make no secret (of one's presence)/grandiose/with great scope
surreptitious/sneaky
displaying strength and discipline/impressive/upright and frank/square
openly and without fear/brazenly
in a way that justifies the use of the term/genuine/proper/in a way that conforms to logic/justifiable/appropriate/perfectly legitimate
confident/calm/natural/poised
in the right and self-confident (idiom); bold and confident with justice on one's side/to have the courage of one's convictions/just and forceful
to be in hiding
with great fanfare
to be secretive; to try to cover up (idiom)
absolutely unrestrained/unbridled/without the slightest scruple
to have no sense of shame
to have a clear conscience/to have no qualms about sth
shameful
top secret/hush-hush
